could have also been `Makie.jl`  I think that wasn't updated last week to work with the newest abstractplotting ( as you can see here, `using Makie` direclty is also kind of deprecated: <https://github.com/JuliaPlots/AbstractPlotting.jl/pull/576>
There is a bit of churn on the API and packages etc, since we're trying to clean up everything right now

text:
Ah, I've also been using `using Makie` directly. Luckily I was able to debug what was going on in order to get the plots made, and to be honest, even with API instability the plots were so much easier to make and customize than `Plots.jl` I assume you're one of the core contributors, so I just want to say that I'm loving Makie so far.

So should I use `CairoMakie` or `GLMakie`? It might also be worth putting a disclaimer about which parts of the API are in-flux on the docs, even in stable. It wasn't clear to me what packages I would want to use and why. The choice between Makie, CairoMakie, GLMakie, and whether to include AbstractPlotting/AP.MakieLayout is unclear at the moment for new users.

text: Well that ability to do live updating of data in incredible, and I think that's more you than MakieLayout. The Observable interface is great. Although <@UK1BNFHFV> has done an amazing job with respect to the customization and layout abilities of MakieLayout. I feel like Makie really offers an interactive plot building workflow that isn't really offered anywhere else.
